Label: project_name
Value: Archaeal and Bacterial diversity of geographically and geologically distinct deep-sea hydrothermal vent mineral deposits

Label: project_funding

Flores) with all sequencing performed at Oak Ridge National Laboratory, managed by UT-Battelle, LLC for the U.S. Department of Energy under contract no. DE-AC05-00OR22725.

Label: PI_organization
Value: Department of Biology, Center for Life in Extreme Environments, Portland State University

Label: project_description
Value: Deep-sea hydrothermal vent deposits host diverse microbial communities. How these communities vary in different geologic settings remains largely unknown. Here, using barcoded pyrosequencing of the variable region 4 (V4) of the 16S rRNA gene we explored the archaeal and bacterial diversity of deposits from numerous vents sites around the globe. Vent fields surveyed include deposits from the Mid-Atlantic Ridge, Eastern Lau Spreading Center and Guaymas Basin. Results of these various studies have been published in the following articles:

Category: Flores, G.E., Campbell, J., Kirshtein, J., Meneghin, J., Podar, M., Steinberg, J.I. Tivey, M.K., Voytek, M., Yang, Z.K. and Reysenbach, A.-L. (2011) Microbial community structure of hydrothermal deposits from geochemically different vent fields along the Mid-Atlantic Ridge. Environmental Microbiology. 13: 2158-2171.

Flores G.E., Wagner I.D., Liu Y. and Reysenbach, A.-L. (2012) Distribution, abundance, and diversity patterns of the thermoacidophilic �deep-sea hydrothermal vent euryarchaeota 2�. Front. Microbio. 3:47. doi: 10.3389/fmicb.2012.00047

Flores, G.E., Shakya, M., Meneghin, J., Yang, Z.K., Seewald, J.S., Wheat, C.G., Podar, M. and Reysenbach, A.-L. (Accepted) Inter-field variability in the microbial communities of hydrothermal vent deposits from a back-arc basin. Geobiology.

Label: DESCRIPTION
Value: Actively venting hydrothermal vent mineral deposits were collected during four separate cruises over the course of 5 years. Samples lau001-lau062 were collected in 2009 from the Eastern Lau Spreading Center. Samples lebeled "lau05T408, lau05166 and lau05247" were collected in 2005 from the Eastern Lau Spreading Center. Samples mar001-mar015 were collected in 2008 from the Mid-Atlantic Ridge. Samples gua031-gua441 were collected in 2009 from the Guyamas Basin.

Label: EXPERIMENT_DESIGN_DESCRIPTION
Value: Actively venting hydrothermal vent mineral deposits were collected during four separate cruises over the course of 5 years. Samples lau001-lau062 were collected in 2009 from the Eastern Lau Spreading Center. Samples lebeled "lau05T408, lau05166 and lau05247" were collected in 2005 from the Eastern Lau Spreading Center. Samples mar001-mar015 were collected in 2008 from the Mid-Atlantic Ridge. Samples gua031-gua441 were collected in 2009 from the Guyamas Basin.

Label: LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL
Value: The amplicon products were purified using AMPure paramagnetic beads followed by analysis of their concentration and size using DNA 1000 chips on an Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer. Amplicon libraries were prepared for unidirectional sequencing using the emPCR Kit II followed by sequencing on a 454 Life Sciences Genome Sequencer FLX. Based on the use of identifying key tags, 20 individual samples were pooled and sequenced on each of the two sides of the picotitre plate.
